intro: Komsbergella sphalmanthoides, commonly known as the mountain candelabra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, branched structure resembling a candelabra. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
